thread.title: Santi Cazorla to miss rest of the season with ankle injury in huge blow for Arsenal
thread.title_full: Santi Cazorla to miss rest of the season with ankle injury in huge blow for Arsenal

author: supal
title: Santi Cazorla to miss rest of the season with ankle injury in huge blow for Arsenal
text:
SANTI KO Santi Cazorla to miss rest of the season with ankle injury in huge blow for Arsenal 
Arsenal are set to be without the Spanish midfielder for the remainder of the season, according to reports Gossip Comments SANTI CAZORLA could be sidelined for the rest of the season in a damaging blow for Arsenal. 
The Mirror report that the Spanish midfielder is focusing on returning in August for the start of next season. Getty Images 3 Santi Cazorla could miss the rest of the season as he recovers from an ankle injury 
Arsenal manager Arsene Wenger was hopeful Cazorla would return from his ankle problem before the end of the current campaign. 
Cazorla had surgery on his right ankle back in December and was initially thought to return to action in three months, but his boss has revealed he has had to undergo another procedure. 
Last month, Wenger said: “He’s far from starting to run again. 
“He had a little procedure, yes, but we have a meeting with the medical people to see what it was.” RELATED ARTICLES Sweet FA Jose Mourinho fumes as Man United's FA Cup tie at Chelsea is moved to Monday on Europa League week BEAT THE CLOCK Spurs boss Mauricio Pochettino says it will only take a minute to tell if they can beat Gent ABU HAVING FUN? Manchester City's stars arrive at their luxurious 5-star Emirates Palace Abu Dhabi hotel - where the cheapest room is £500 A NIGHT ZAZA ZOOM Valencia 2 Real Madrid 1: Simone Zaza stunner blows La Liga title race wide open despite Cristiano Ronaldo's goal in his 700th appearance INJURY BLOW Henrikh Mkhitaryan limps off injured in first half and set to miss EFL Cup final this weekend Guard down Liverpool handed major boost in pursuit of Joe Hart as Manchester City say he is available for £20m PA:Press Association Cazorla hasn’t played for Arsenal since their win over Ludogorets in October Getty Images 3 The Spanish midfielder has set his sights on returning in August for next season 
Wenger does believe that Cazorla will feature again before the end of the campaign, he said: ” Yeah, I hope so. 
“Because once you start to go out (running outside) you have to count six weeks’ preparation. 
“At the moment he’s not at that level, so let’s hope he can come back in the next three or four weeks on the pitch.” 
Cazorla has made close to 200 appearances for the Gunners since signing from Malaga in 2012, and has won two FA Cups. 
He hasn’t played since the 6-0 win over Ludogorets in the Champions League in October.
